Quotes: One leader, one people, signifies one master and millions of slaves.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Never lose a holy curiosity.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Fatigue is the best pillow.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: He that won't be counseled can't be helped.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: He that's secure is not safe.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Justice without force is powerless;force without justice is tyrannical.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quotes: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Rather leave the crime of the guilty unpunished than condemn the innocent.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Thrift is of great revenue.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Hatred is settled anger.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Advice in old age is foolish;for what can be more absurd than to increase our provisions for the road the nearer we approach to our journey's end.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quotes: Wars are caused by undefended wealth.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Therefore if a man look sharply and attentively, he shall see Fortune;for though she be blind, yet she is not invisible.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: There is a wisdom in this beyond the rules of physic: a man's own observation what he finds good of and what he finds hurt of is the best physic to preserve health.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: It's the height of folly to want to be the only wise one.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: The only thing that should surprise us is that there are still some things that can surprise us.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: A wise man thinks it more advantageous not to join the battle than to win.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: He who lives without folly isn't so wise as he thinks.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: It's easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Too great haste to repay an obligation is a kind of ingratitude.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: In the last analysis, even the best man is evil: in the last analysis, even the best woman is bad.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Before the effect one believes in different causes than one does after the effect.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: England and America are two countries separated by the same language.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The golden rule is that there are no golden rules.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Power does not corrupt men;fools, however, if they get into a position of power, corrupt power.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: That's what a man wants in a wife, mostly;he wants to make sure one fool tells him he's wise.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Capital punishment is as fundamentally wrong as a cure for crime as charity is wrong as a cure for poverty.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: A mother who is really a mother is never free.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: A woman should never be seen eating or drinking, unless it be lobster salad and Champagne, the only true feminine and becoming viands.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Loyalty to the country always. Loyalty to the government when it deserves it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Nothing so needs reforming as other people's habits.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Perfect reason flees all extremity, and leads one to be wise with sobriety.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: People of quality know everything without ever having learned anything.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: Bigamy is having one wife too many. Monogamy is the same.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Everything you can imagine is real.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: I never say I am a guru.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: Silence is better than unmeaning words.
Author: Pitagora

Quotes: The most important part of education is proper training in the nursery.
Author: Plato

Quotes: He was a wise man who invented beer.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Democracy passes into despotism.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The wisest have the most authority.
Author: Plato

Quotes: There's a victory, and defeat;the first and best of victories, the lowest and worst of defeats which each man gains or sustains at the hands not of another, but of himself.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The punishment which the wise suffer who refuse to take part in the government, is to live under the government of worse men.
Author: Plato

Quotes: A hero is born among a hundred, a wise man is found among a thousand, but an accomplished one might not be found even among a hundred thousand men.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Wise men speak because they have something to say;Fools because they have to say something.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Strong and bitter words indicate a weak cause.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: The wise man does not grow old, but ripens.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: He is a hard man who is only just, and a sad one who is only wise.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: He who is not just is severe, he who is not wise is sad.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Is there anyone so wise as to learn by the experience of others?
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: If the fool would persist in his folly he would become wise.
Author: William Blake

Quotes: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.
Author: William Blake

Quotes: Having nothing, nothing can he lose.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Listen to many, speak to a few.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Let no such man be trusted.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity, for wise men say it is the wisest course.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Modest doubt is called the beacon of the wise.
Author: William Shakespeare
